Question: This person's sale of his shares in the Rangers in 1998 brought him over $15 million from his initial $800,000 investment.
Hints: This person is the second president to have been the son of a former president, the first being John Quincy Adams.
This person was an advocate of China's entry into the World Trade Organization.
The relationship between India and the United States was one that dramatically improved during this person's tenure.
